title: Forensic Applied Mathematics: Online Resource-Based Intensive Short-Term Course (Patient Diagnosis and Evidence Analysis)

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and medical terminology, with intermediate-level application skills (preference given to experience in analyzing patient data)
context.additional_context: Establishing blended learning environments using digital tools (medical record systems, evidence analysis tools), cultivating practical problem-solving skills through project-based assessments (emphasizing patient safety and treatment protocol adherence)

learning_goals: Apply mathematical modeling techniques for criminal case analysis to integrate and interpret evidence data and patient diagnostic records
Accurately distinguish criteria for evaluating the reliability of online legal and scientific materials (medical protocols, symptom records, etc.) with over 80% accuracy
Through team projects, learners will prepare statistical analysis reports for forensic problem-solving, including patient symptom patterns and treatment effectiveness analyses

resources: National Forensic Science Institute Webinar Materials
Access Permissions for LMS (Learning Management System) Platforms

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
